generated_json.title: History of present illness
content: The patient reports ongoing crepitus in the neck region, described as a cracking and creaking sensation, though not painful and not radiating. She notes the sensation is present during certain movements but is not constant. The low back pain has improved but is not fully resolved; she reports a mild twinge in the right buttock area, possibly related to lifting a heavy pot. She denies any radiating pain to the thighs, legs, or arms. She is not taking any pain medications and reports good function with walking, standing, and performing exercises. She has been doing yoga and has improved strength and mobility, particularly with engaging her lower abdomen during leg lifts. She has a history of cervical radiculopathy and isthmic spondylolisthesis. The patient is currently experiencing approximately 90% relief from symptoms following injections, with no significant limitations in daily activities.
generated_json.instruction: Summarize the patient’s History of Present Illness (HPI) as a clear, professional paragraph in clinical note style. Include only details explicitly stated in the transcript: symptoms, onset, duration, location, severity, aggravating or relieving factors, treatments tried, impact on daily life, and relevant prior evaluations or consultations. Maintain chronological flow. Exclude physical exam findings, imaging results, and assessment details. Do not infer or assume information. Use full sentences and natural scribe-style narrative.

generated_json.title: Vitals
content: Vitals were not mentioned in the transcript. Height, weight, and BMI were not documented.
generated_json.instruction: Extract all information related to the patient’s vitals. Include whether vitals were filed for the visit, whether height and weight are documented, and whether BMI is available or could be calculated. If any of these are explicitly stated as absent or not on file, include that. If no vitals are mentioned, return “-”.

generated_json.title: Physical Exam
content: The physical exam was performed. The exam of the neck and back was normal except for mild tenderness in the right buttock area. The patient demonstrated good strength, sensation, and range of motion in the upper and lower extremities. No neurological deficits were noted. The exam findings were consistent with previous evaluations.
generated_json.instruction: Extract details of the physical examination if mentioned. Include whether an exam was performed, the date (if available), and a concise summary of the findings. If findings are described as unchanged or consistent with previous exams, include that. If no physical exam is mentioned, return “No physical exam mentioned.”

content: Alignment: Normal
Sensation: Intact in all extremities
Range of Motion: Full range of motion in neck and lumbar spine with no pain during movement

Reflexes: Normal patellar and ankle reflexes bilaterally, no clonus

generated_json.instruction:
Extract the neurologic and lumbar exam findings exactly as stated in the transcript. Organize the findings under these categories if present:
Alignment
Sensation

Strength (with muscle groups and scores if given)
Reflexes (patellar, ankle, clonus)
Include laterality (left/right) where mentioned. Return only what is explicitly stated. If no findings are reported, return “-”.

generated_json.title: Assessment
content: Cervical radiculopathy
Isthmic spondylolisthesis
Status post injection therapy
Low back pain with residual crepitus
generated_json.instruction:
Generate the Assessment as a concise list of the patient’s active diagnoses or conditions relevant to this visit.
Rules:
Include symptom-based problems (e.g., “back pain”) and diagnosis-based terms (e.g., “spinal stenosis”).
Exclude normal findings and negative statements.
Include “status post” only if it describes an ongoing issue (e.g., “stiffness after surgery”).
Keep terms short and scribe-style, without exam details or explanations.
Return strictly as a list (one item per line, with dash or bullet).
If no active conditions are mentioned, return “-”.

content: Continue current exercise program including yoga and targeted strengthening exercises.
Avoid heavy lifting and prolonged sitting.
Monitor for red flags: worsening pain, weakness, or numbness.
Return to clinic in four months for follow-up.
Patient instructed on do's and don'ts related to back and neck care.
generated_json.instruction:
Write the doctor’s plan exactly as dictated, in scribe-style summary form.
Rules:
Include only treatments, procedures, medications, therapies, referrals, patient education, and follow-up instructions explicitly mentioned in the transcript.
Do not add or assume any details (e.g., do not invent follow-up times unless stated).
If a follow-up is specified, include it exactly as dictated, formatted as: “Return to clinic in X days/weeks/months.”
Use short sentences or numbered/bulleted steps.
If no plan is mentioned, return “-”.
